newsitem.title: UK: Royal & Sun up on Goldman recommendation.
newsitem.headline: Royal & Sun up on Goldman recommendation.

text.p: Royal & Sun Alliance Insurance Group Plc put on 10p to 498-1/2p in early trading on Friday after Goldman Sachs raised its recommendation and its profit forecasts for the group.

Goldman upgraded Royal to its "top European priority list" from "market outperformer" and lifted current year pre-tax figures to 870 million stg from 850 million and for 1998 to one billion stg from 970 million, Goldman analyst Stephen Dias said.
"It's among the best European ideas we've got," said Dias.

"We believe the merger (of Royal Insurance and Sun Alliance) is not just about cost cutting but positioning the whole company powerfully for the future. UK insurers look quite cheap and this is a big call on the whole sector," he said.

Commercial Union Plc put on a penny to 685p, Legal & General Group Plc 2p to 433-1/2p, General Accident Plc fell 5p to 942-1/2p, after a big rise on Thursday, and Guardian Royal Exchange Plc put on 2p to 296-1/2p.
